snippet: Hundreds of microblog users across the country have been arrested for what Communist Party officials call malicious rumor-mongering online.
abstract: China's government is aggressively cracking down on country's microblog users, arresting hundreds in most zealous Internet censoring push in years; worried about bloggers' hold on public opinion, government is pursuing propaganda and police offensive against what it calls malicious anti-government rumor-mongering online.

byline.contributor: Amy Qin and Lucy Chen contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of microblog users across the country have been arrested for what Communist Party officials call malicious rumor-mongering online.

headline.main: Crackdown on Bloggers Is Mounted by China
headline.print_headline: Crackdown On Bloggers Is Mounted By China
